text: ABS_CALL = the call in an absolute analysis that indicates if the transcript was present (P), absent (A), or marginal (M)
DETECTION P-VALUE = p-value that indicates the significance level of the detection call

protocol.text: *** The CEL file for Sample GSM507061 is truncated. A complete CEL file was requested but not provided. ***

Plants were grown in Aratrays (Arasytem, Beta Tech) under constant conditions (20°C, constant 2400 lux globe lighting). Biological insecticide Intercept 70WG was added to the water used to moisten the soil before sowing. Seeds were sown in soil, incubated at 4°C for 4 days, and placed in constant conditions. Watering was performed with tap water every two days avoiding saturation of the soil.

Total RNA was isolated from mature rosette leaves following the Rneasy Plant Mini Kit from Qiagen. Briefly fresh tissue (pool of 20 plants) was collected manually and weighed. Immediately placed in liquid nitrogen and grinded with a mortar and pestle until a fine powder was obtained. According to the initial weight powder was decanted in liquid nitrogen-cooled Rnase-free microcentrifuge tubes (100mg of initial material per tube, ex if initial material was 500mg then powder divided in 5 tubes and in label specified they were from the same extraction). 500 microlitres of buffer RLT previously adjusted with B-mercaptoethanol was added to the samples and the tubes were placed in a vortex, vortexing for 5 minutes vigorously (Vortex Genie-2, setting 9, Scientific Industries). The lysate was pipetted directly onto a QIAshredder spin column and centrifuged for 2 minutes at 16.1g (Eppendorf Centrigue 5415D). 0.5V of ethanol was added to the cleared lysate, mixed by pipetting, applied onto the Rneasy mini column and centrifuged for 30 s at 14.7g. The column was after washed with buffer RW1 twice (first with 700 microlitres and after with 350 microlitres) and the on-column Dnase digestion performed. Dnase I solution was prepared by mixing 10 microlitres of Dnase I (1500 Kunits in 550 microlitres of Rnase-free water) with 70 microlitres of buffer RDD. 80 microlitres of Dnase I solution per sample was added onto the Rneasy silica-gel membrane and digestion was allowed for 15 minutes at 20 Celsius degrees. After the incubation time, columns were washed with 350 microlitres of buffer RW1 and centrifuged for 30 s at 14.7g. Then columns were placed into a new collection tube and washed with 500 microlitres of RPE buffer and centrifuged as before (30s, 14.7g). A final wash with 500 microlitres of RPE was carried out and samples were centrifuged for 2 minutes, at 14.7g. The columns were then placed in a new collection tube and centrifuged at 16.1g for 1 minute. Next, columns were placed into new Rnase free-collection tubes and 50 microlitres of Rnase-free water pipetted directly onto the membrane and incubated for 10 minutes before elution. To elute, samples were centrifuged for 1 minute at 14.7g. Concentration of RNA as well as the Ratio A260/A280 was determined for each sample. All the samples with a ratio near 2.0 from the same liquid-nitrogen grinded step were pool in the same collection tube and the RNA was precipitated. For the precipitation procedure, 1/10 volume of NaAC and 2 volumes of ethanol 100% were added to the pooled sample mixed by vortex and incubated overnight at -20 Celsius degrees. Next day samples were centrifuged 10 minutes at 16.1g and the pellet was washed once with ethanol 70%, centrifuged for 10 minutes at 16.1g and air-dried. Dryed pellets were resuspended in 30 microliters of Rnase-free water and concentration and Ratio A260/A280 determined. Samples with high quality were selected for the experiment.
Labelled using protocol described in manual Affymetrix GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual, One-Cycle target labelling
Biotin Labelled cRNA using Affymetrix GeneChip Hybridization, Wash and Stain Kit, according to guidelines set out by Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA
Scanned according to guidelines set out by Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA.
Raw data from the microarrays was normalized at probe-level using MAS5 algorithm. The detection calls (present, marginal, absent) for each probe set was obtained using the GCOS system.
